huntBios.SAFETY_CONS: The vast majority of this hunt boundary includes extremely remote, extremely rugged terrain with very few roads and virtually no cell service.  Please be prepared and self-sufficient.
huntBios.WEATHER_CONS: This area consists almost entirely of steep rugged canyons.  These canyons will be prone to flash flooding during and after periods of rainfall.  Most of the unit occurs at relatively low elevations so snow tends not to accumulate.  Snow does tend to persist in the bottoms of these canyons as they receive very little sunlight.  The upper elevations in upper Range Creek, Rattlesnake, Tushar, and Floy Canyons usually receive good snowfall but are difficult to access
huntBios.BIOLOGIST_NOTES: This hunt targets cougars that prey primarily on bighorn sheep.  Cougar densities are likely fairly low due to relatively low prey densities compared to higher elevation ranges where cougars primarily prey on deer and elk.  This rough, rocky country that is tough on dogs.  Snow will melt off the south facing slopes relatively quickly.  Bighorn sheep reside primarily in the canyons surrounding the lower Price River from Woodside to the Confluence and along the lower Green River and the major canyons flowing in to it.  Good canyons where bighorn sheep (and likely cougars) reside include Poverty, Rattlesnake, Butler, Swasey, Tushar, Coal, Horse, Floy, and Sego Canyons on the east side of the Green River.  On the west side of the Green River one can find good habitat in lower Range Creek, Long Canyon, Short Canyon, Sand Knolls Canyon, and Jenny Canyons.  Very few cougars are harvested here.

huntMaster.HUNT_NAME: Book Cliffs, Rattlesnake Canyon/Nine Mile, South
huntMaster.PRINT_HUNT_NAME: Book Cliffs, Rattlesnake Canyon/Nine Mile, South - Hunt #CG1002
huntMaster.SPECIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Permit holders may hunt any open harvest objective season. Before you begin a hunting trip to a harvest objective unit, you must visit the Cougar Harvest Objective Page to verify that a unit is still open. The website will be updated each day by noon MST. Updates become effective the following day, 30 minutes before official sunrise. Effective for the 2021-22 season, there will no longer be a phone line available to check for open units.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: Required: Any harvested cougar must be checked by a DWR employee within 48 hours of the date of kill. The DWR employee will affix a permanent possession tag to the pelt or unskinned carcass. You may not possess an unskinned carcass or green pelt after the 48 hour check-in period. If you need to reach a Division employee after regular business hours, over a weekend, or on a holiday, contact your local police dispatch. In addition, you cannot ship a green pelt out of the state of Utah or present it to a taxidermist if the pelt does not have a permanent possession tag attached.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: The vast majority of the unit is public land.  The exception is the Green River Valley near the town of Green River
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: There are no developed campgrounds on the unit.  Plenty of dispersed camping opportunities exist on BLM lands.  Most people camp along the lower Price River east of Woodside, along the Green River north of the town of Green River or in Tushar Canyon
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: The Horse Canyon road is accessed off of SR-6 25 miles south of Price; the lower Price River road can be accessed off of SR-6 at the town of Woodside; the Hastings Road will access the east side of the Green River and can be found on the east side of the town of Green River, the Sego Canyon road is at the eastern boundary of the unit and is accessed in the town of Thompson.  Numerous small roads will access the mouths of Tushar, Coal, Horse, and Floy canyons.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The vast majority of the unit is public land.  Private lands exist in the Green River Valley.  Isolated private parcels can be found in the
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Emery and Grand counties--Boundary begins at I-70 and US-6; east on I-70 to the Thompson Canyon road at Thompson; north on this road to the Sego Canyon road; north on this road to the Ute Indian Reservation boundary; west along this boundary to the Green River; north along this river to Range Creek; northwest along this creek to the Turtle Canyon/Little Park road;  west and north on this road to the Horse Canyon road; west on this road to US-6; south on US-6 to I-70.  EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Huntington, Price, Moab, Westwater. Boundary questions? Call the Price office, 435-613-3700.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_NAME: Book Cliffs, Rattlesnake Canyon/Nine Mile, South
